newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Israel deports man detained in Lebanon to Syria.
newsitem.headline: Israel deports man detained in Lebanon to Syria.

text.p: Israel on Thursday deported to Syria a man whom it detained in Lebanon 10 years ago and held inside the Jewish state, the army said.
"Basem Ghanem was deported today to Syria...(he) belonged to a Fatah squad that encountered an army force on May 7, 1987, in Lebanon," it said in a statement.
It said Ghanem was handed over to representatives of the International Committee of the Red Cross who escorted him over the border.
It did not say if the deportation was coordinated with Syria.
The army statement said that an Israeli court convicted Ghanem of charges which it did not specify and sentenced him to a 10-year jail term "around 1990".
Another Israeli court recently ordered Ghanem released and deported to Syria. It said that the man was on his way to take hostages in Israel when he was captured in Lebanon in 1987.
Fatah is the mainstream faction in the Palestine Liberation Organisation.
